title: Analysis of composite function part - c

content.description: Let f be a twice-differentiable function such that f(2)=5 and f(5)=2. Let g be the function given by g(x)=f(f(x)).
content.question: Show that if f''(x)=0 for all x, then the graph of g does not have a point of inflection.

frqParts.text: Show that if f''(x)=0 for all x, then the graph of g does not have a point of inflection.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
